page.title: 10Pubs in West Farnham
page.content: Farnham has always been well endowed with pubs. In 1892 there were 93; in 1901 there was one pub for every 155 people.Today there are 12 pubs in our D-Block. Among the best known are : {The Bricklayers Arms -}was originally situated along Abbey Street,but has been re-established along Weydon Lane. {The Wheatsheaf-}is situated along West Street but it has been reconstructed in recent years.For the last quarter of the 18th century and much of the 19th century the pub was owned by Knights Brewery.It was sold in 1888 to the Farnham Brewery.They offered it for sale 3 years later,and Reid's Brewery bought it in 1896.The Wheatsheaf is the setting of a detail in Michael Sadliers "Forlon Sunset".{ {The Plough-}is a timber and brick pub existing in 1806 and reconstructed in 1933-34.It used to have a brewhouse.
